name: Campbell's® Slow-Cooked Pulled Pork Sandwiches
author: Campbell's Kitchen
summary: These fabulous sandwiches feature pork shoulder that is slow cooked in a scrumptious sauce made with Campbell's® Condensed French Onion Soup, ketchup, vinegar and brown sugar, to serve on sandwich buns.
ingredients: 3 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder roast, netted or tied
1 (10.5 ounce) can  Campbell's® Condensed French Onion Soup
12 roll (blank)s round sandwich rolls or hamburger rolls, split
directions: Heat the oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat
Add the pork and cook until it's well browned on all sides
Stir the soup, ketchup, vinegar and brown sugar in a 5-quart slow cooker
Add the pork and turn to coat
Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 9 hours* or until the pork is fork-tender
Remove the pork from the cooker to a cutting board and let stand for 10 minutes
Return the pork to the cooker
Divide the pork and sauce mixture among the rolls
